stream_context.summary: Kaze live-models and tweaks Course 1’s sky-area, re-theming it from blocky ‘Minecraft’ look to a colourful Yoshi’s-Island birdhouse zone while brainstorming a new vine/flower elevator mechanic. He tests physics, discusses a soft-cap slide fix, debates colour/texture choices with Biobak, and outlines plans for a public Course 1 demo (3-8 weeks) bundled with a feedback questionnaire on camera and physics.

development_findings.summary: Skybox replaced with Yoshi’s Island imagery to strengthen thematic cohesion.
development_findings.quote: The skybox is so much better than before, and it's now Yoshi's Island related, which is very very good.

development_findings.summary: Area visually re-themed into a giant birdhouse; blocky ‘Minecraft’ elements being removed.
development_findings.quote: Let's make this look like a birdhouse, fuck it; you start in a birdhouse, you end in a birdhouse.

development_findings.summary: Trees now use double-layer vertex-coloured billboards; lower layer tinted lighter to simulate fog depth after Biobak’s suggestion.
development_findings.quote: Leave them the way they were, but make the bottom layer whiter and more transparent, so it looks like they are going down in the fog.

development_findings.summary: New sliding physics: vanilla hard cap of 100 speed replaced by a soft cap—values above 95 decay 5 % per frame—preserving speed when entering slides fast.
development_findings.quote: Usually in vanilla Mario 64 the sliding is hard capped at 100 speed… I soft capped it at 95 so when you're above 95 you asymptotically approach 95.

development_findings.summary: HD textures budgeted: 16 textures at 0x900 each, roughly 36 KB of ROM space, deemed acceptable.
development_findings.quote: Using HD textures like the background here do cost a little bit of ROM space… 36 kilobytes, which is not too much.

development_findings.summary: Flower-bud elevator mechanic conceived: a Yoshi’s-Island plant bud that senses Mario, can be ‘plucked’ via Bowser-spin input, then grows upward and auto-spins, acting as an elevator to the sky section; will replace current pipe.
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking of an animated flower bud here… when you try it Mario does the Bowser animation… the flower comes out and you jump from leaf to leaf to get up.

development_findings.summary: Decision to cut 100-coin stars; replaced by six Yoshi coins collectible during any mission.
development_findings.quote: No 100 coin stars… you just need to collect six [Yoshi coins] and they can be collected anytime.

development_findings.summary: Hub world confirmed as essential ‘glue’ and will exist.
development_findings.quote: There will be a big hub world Leo, a hub world is very important for an R64 like, it's gluing the whole game together.

development_findings.summary: Demo strategy: Course 1–only build in ~3–8 weeks with questionnaire covering auto-rotate camera, pan speed, pitch limits, physics likes/dislikes, and bug reports.
development_findings.quote: I'm thinking of releasing a demo with just course 1… together with a questionnaire… ideally we'd have it done within the next 3 or 4 weeks.

context_findings.summary: Kaze feels mental fatigue, attributes it to prolonged stress and new-parent sleep disruption.
context_findings.quote: Maybe I was just stressed out for so long that my brain functionality is temporarily reduced.

context_findings.summary: He now has a four-week-old daughter, complicating scheduling and reducing bonus streams.
context_findings.quote: If you haven't noticed, I have a small child. That makes planning things really fucking difficult.

context_findings.summary: Upload schedule shifting thanks to hiring an editor; aiming for weekly videos and ramp-up in December.
context_findings.quote: That's the awesome part about having an editor, I can make so many videos now… I'm gonna try to make like one video every week.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with new Blender version edge-split behaviour and general tech changes.
context_findings.quote: This new Blender vertex thing… Execute them.

biobak.summary: Advises on tree rendering: proposes double-layer, lighter lower layer for depth-fade; provides real-time colour feedback.
biobak.quote: Leave them the way they were, but make the bottom layer whiter and more transparent, so it looks like they are going down in the fog.

biobak.summary: Participates in OST selection discussion and approves birdhouse theme.

key_stories.title: Soft-Cap Sliding Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze notices vanilla Mario 64’s hard slide-speed cap feels wrong when entering a slope at high speed. He rewrites the routine to use a soft cap, preserving momentum yet converging to 95 units, keeping the original feel for normal slides.
key_stories.challenge: Vanilla hard cap instantly deletes speed above 100, making advanced movement feel jarring.
key_stories.process: Re-coded slide physics so speeds > 95 decay 5 % per frame rather than hard-clamp.
key_stories.outcome: Players keep extra speed when they earn it; base gameplay remains familiar.
key_stories.key_quote: When you slide on with a lot of speed, you will keep that speed, which feels good I think.

key_stories.title: Replacing the Pipe with a Flower Elevator
key_stories.summary: While polishing Course 1, Kaze decides the existing pipe to the sky section is thematically weak. Brainstorming live, he conceives a Yoshi’s-Island flower bud that players ‘pluck’ to create a spinning vine elevator.
key_stories.challenge: Need a more natural, Yoshi-authentic way to reach the sky area without confusing newcomers.
key_stories.process: Live modelling a bud, debating hints (bunny NPC, animation speed), planning input mechanics and fade-out rendering.
key_stories.outcome: Pipe to be cut; new animated flower mechanic prototyped off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I think this bud wants to come out but I'm not strong enough to pull it out… then the flower comes out like really fast.

key_stories.title: Community-Driven Demo Plan
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines a public Course 1 demo within two months, bundled with a detailed Google-form questionnaire to fine-tune camera and physics before full release.
key_stories.challenge: Need empirical data to confirm new movement/camera feels good to a broad audience.
key_stories.process: Set video schedule, specify question topics, plan to hire ChatGPT/human editor for clearer wording.
key_stories.outcome: Target 3-4 weeks (max 8) for demo; course prepared accordingly.
key_stories.key_quote: I want more data on gameplay… so that when I release the full game, we know for sure people like the camera and the physics.
